title: Competitive Tracking To Monitor Your Traffic Share | Similarweb
description: Uncover digital blindspots with Competitive Tracking and dive deeper into page-level insights with our latest Segment Analysis features. Read all about it.
content: HomeBlogUpdatesProduct UpdatesNew Feature: Make Smarter Data-Driven Business Decisions With Competitive Tracking Updates New Feature: Make Smarter Data-Driven Business Decisions With Competitive Tracking Try it now by Chloe Nicholls , Product Marketing Manager, Similarweb 3 Min. September 10, 2021 X Facebook Linkedin Copy link Free Website Traffic Checker Discover your competitors' strengths and leverage them to achieve your own success Analyze Traffic Top features this month Competitive Tracking Exact URL for Segment Analysis Daily Granularity for Segment Analysis We know that the ability to track and monitor your competitive landscape is a mission-critical task for any digital researcher or marketing professional. You need relevant insights to stay competitive in a fast-changing digital world. Until now there wasn’t a centralized way to track your competitive landscape and continuously report to your key stakeholders. That’s why we’re excited to share with you the early release of Competitive Tracking to surface the metrics that are important for your business, make smarter business decisions, and ultimately grow your market share. Plus, we’ve rolled out improved enhancements to our premium feature, Segment Analysis, for deeper page-level insights. 1. Win your market with Competitive Tracking Competitive Tracking is the most innovative way to measure and track your digital traffic share and the performance of your competitive landscape. This new feature will help you to: Track your competitor landscape with an aggregated view directly against your competitors, allowing you to monitor digital traffic share over time Enable an apples-to-apples comparison by benchmarking websites and segments based on comprehensive analysis Quickly surface insights based on changing competitive dynamics and know when to adapt your strategy or react to potential threats For example, if you’re a retailer and you want to monitor your digital market share against other core business lines within your competitive set or if you’re a publisher, and need to track your share of voice against other media companies that cover similar topics such as tech, politics, or health news. You can find the Competitive Tracking feature in the brand new section “My Trackers” in the top navigation bar. It is an evolution of our Workspace and has been released in closed beta so we can gather valuable feedback from our users. We have a lot more product updates to add in the future and this is just the beginning of the digital monitoring journey. 2. New enhancements to the Segment Analysis feature Analyze laser-focused page-level insights faster than ever We’ve rolled out a unique way to analyze websites, landing pages, and product pages in just a few clicks. The new feature is called Exact URL and it’s available in Segment Analysis. It will enable you to build a website segment based on the specific URL of any page. Compare daily trends for better forecasting and get ahead of the game We’ve also added daily granularity within the Segment Comparison mode so you can analyze seasonal trends such as Black Friday, Superbowl, and Election Day to identify peaks in traffic across specific dates and discover who is gaining traction or underperforming during tentpole moments. Ready to take Similarweb for a spin? Check out our new features by logging into your Similarweb account or get in touch for a demo. Have any feedback to share? Your ideas and suggestions help us prioritize which features to develop next. Get in touch via our Live Chat, Social, or through your Account Manager. Thanks for reading. See you next month. by Chloe Nicholls Product Marketing Manager, Similarweb Chloe, with 10+ years in B2B marketing, is passionate about data-driven business decisions. Based in London, she enjoys the arts, cafes, and theatres. Related Topics: Company Research Product Updates This post is subject to Similarweb legal notices and disclaimers.
